title: Diwali
content_text: The Festival of Lights celebrated across India with lamps, fireworks, and sweets.

title: Holi
content_text: The Festival of Colors celebrated with vibrant powders and water festivities.

title: Dussehra
content_text: Marks the victory of good over evil, celebrated with effigy burning and processions.

title: Durga Puja
content_text: A grand celebration of Goddess Durga, especially in West Bengal.

title: Ganesh Chaturthi
content_text: Celebrating the birth of Lord Ganesha with idols, processions, and immersion.

title: Onam
content_text: Kerala’s harvest festival with boat races, floral designs, and feasts.

title: Pongal
content_text: Tamil Nadu’s harvest festival, celebrated with special dishes and kolam designs.

title: Baisakhi
content_text: Punjab’s harvest festival marked by dancing, fairs, and processions.

title: Eid-ul-Fitr
content_text: Celebrated by Muslims across India marking the end of Ramadan.

title: Christmas
content_text: Christian festival celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ with prayers and festivities.

title: Janmashtami
content_text: Celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna, especially in Mathura and Vrindavan.

title: Navratri
content_text: Nine nights of worship, dance, and music dedicated to Goddess Durga.

title: Lohri
content_text: Punjabi winter folk festival with bonfires, music, and dance.

title: Bihu
content_text: Assam’s major harvest festival celebrated with dance and feasts.

title: Chhath Puja
content_text: Bihar’s festival worshipping the Sun God with riverbank rituals.

title: Raksha Bandhan
content_text: Celebrates the bond between brothers and sisters with rakhi tying.

title: Makar Sankranti
content_text: Harvest festival marked by kite flying and sweets, especially in Gujarat.

title: Mahavir Jayanti
content_text: Jain festival celebrating the birth of Lord Mahavir.

title: Buddha Purnima
content_text: Commemorates the birth, enlightenment, and death of Buddha.

title: Gurpurab
content_text: Sikh festival marking the birthdays of Sikh Gurus with processions and prayers.

title: Karva Chauth
content_text: North Indian festival where married women fast for their husbands' well-being.

title: Vishu
content_text: Kerala’s New Year festival with feasts and traditional rituals.

title: Ugadi
content_text: New Year festival in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Karnataka.

title: Gudi Padwa
content_text: Maharashtrian New Year marked by flag hoisting and sweets.

title: Ram Navami
content_text: Celebrates the birth of Lord Rama with prayers and processions.

title: Maha Shivaratri
content_text: Night dedicated to Lord Shiva with fasting and temple rituals.

title: Pushkar Camel Fair
content_text: Rajasthan’s vibrant livestock fair with camel races and cultural events.

title: Hornbill Festival
content_text: Nagaland’s festival showcasing tribal culture, dance, and crafts.

title: Thrissur Pooram
content_text: Kerala’s temple festival with elephant processions and fireworks.

title: Teej
content_text: Monsoon festival for women, celebrated with swings and songs in Rajasthan.

title: Kumbh Mela
content_text: World’s largest religious gathering held at four river-bank pilgrimage sites.

title: Jaisalmer Desert Festival
content_text: Rajasthan’s celebration of desert culture with music, dance, and camel races.

title: Sunburn Festival
content_text: Goa’s international electronic dance music festival.

title: Khajuraho Dance Festival
content_text: Celebrates Indian classical dance forms at the Khajuraho temples.

title: Hampi Festival
content_text: Karnataka’s cultural festival with music, dance, and processions.

title: Sankat Mochan Music Festival
content_text: Classical music festival held at the Sankat Mochan temple in Varanasi.

title: Nehru Trophy Boat Race
content_text: Kerala’s iconic snake boat race held on Punnamada Lake.

title: Ambubachi Mela
content_text: Spiritual festival at Kamakhya Temple, Assam.

title: Deccan Festival
content_text: Hyderabad’s festival celebrating local arts, crafts, and cuisine.

title: Sonepur Mela
content_text: Asia’s largest cattle fair held in Bihar.

title: Baul Fakir Utsav
content_text: West Bengal’s folk music festival celebrating Baul and Fakir traditions.

title: Kite Festival
content_text: International kite festival celebrated in Gujarat during Makar Sankranti.

title: Losar
content_text: Tibetan New Year celebrated in Ladakh and Sikkim.

title: Goa Carnival
content_text: Four-day celebration with parades, music, and dance in Goa.

title: Chennai Music Festival
content_text: December festival celebrating Carnatic classical music in Chennai.

title: Rath Yatra
content_text: Puri’s chariot festival dedicated to Lord Jagannath.

title: Dree Festival
content_text: Arunachal Pradesh’s agricultural festival of the Apatani tribe.

title: Mim Kut
content_text: Mizoram’s post-harvest festival with rituals and feasting.

title: Sair Festival
content_text: Himachal Pradesh’s festival marking the end of the harvest season.

title: Chapchar Kut
content_text: Mizoram’s spring festival celebrated with music, dance, and feasts.
